article.headline: Charleston Southern 87, Coker 46
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Charleston Southern's Chris Moore had 19 points and eight assists as the Buccaneers beat Coker 87-46 on Monday night. Charleston Southern (4-3) trailed just once after Lukas Varga's 3-pointer gave the Cobras (1-3) a 5-4 lead with 16:27 to go in the half. The Buccaneers would hold Coker to just seven more points the rest of the half as the Cobras missed 18 of their next 21 shots to trail 36-12 at the break. At one point Charleston Southern scored 20 points in a row. The Buccaneers shot 54.5 percent (30-of-55) from the field, making 12 of 26 3-pointers, compared to 32.6 percent (15-of-46) shooting from the field for Coker. The Cobras had 21 turnovers and 10 fewer rebounds than Charleston Southern. Dwayne Jackson had 18 points and seven rebounds and Donnell Covington added 17 points for the Buccaneers. Jason Fulwood led Coker with eight points, while Ryan Fulwood added seven.
